pyzui.tile module¶

Class for representing image tiles.

class pyzui.tile.Tile(image)[source]¶

Bases: object

Tile objects allow storage and manipulation of image tiles.

Constructor: Tile(Image or QImage)

Create a new tile with the given image.

crop(bbox)[source]¶

Return the region of the tile contained in the bounding box bbox (x1,y1,x2,y2).

crop(tuple<int,int,int,int>) -> Tile

resize(width, height)[source]¶

Return a resized copy of the tile.

resize(int, int) -> Tile

save(filename)[source]¶

Save the tile to the location given by filename.

save(string) -> None

draw(painter, x, y)[source]¶

Draw the tile on the given painter at the given position.

paint(QPainter, int, int) -> None

property size¶

The dimensions of the tile.

pyzui.tile.new(width, height)[source]¶

Create a new tile with the given dimensions.

new(int, int) -> Tile

pyzui.tile.fromstring(string, width, height)[source]¶

Create a new tile from a string of raw pixels, with the given dimensions.

fromstring(string, int, int) -> Tile

pyzui.tile.merged(t1, t2, t3, t4)[source]¶

Merge the given tiles into a single tile.

t1 must be a Tile, but any or all of t2,`t3`,`t4` may be None, in which case they will be ignored.

merged(Tile, Tile or None, Tile or None, Tile or None) -> Tile
